metadata.title: Freddie Mac Income Underwriting Decision Tree
metadata.description: Decision tree for determining income calculation method and requirements
metadata.usage: Start at root node and traverse based on conditions until reaching a leaf node with calculation instructions

decision_tree.question: What is the primary income type?

options.label: Self-Employment Income (25%+ ownership or Schedule C)

EMPLOYED_ROOT.question: Is this primary or secondary employment?
EMPLOYED_ROOT.context: Primary = main source of income; Secondary = additional jobs beyond primary

EMPLOYED_HISTORY.question: How long has the borrower been employed?

EMPLOYED_SHORT_HISTORY_CHECK.question: Can less than 2-year history be justified?
EMPLOYED_SHORT_HISTORY_CHECK.context: Examples: returning to workforce with prior stable history, new to workforce after school/training

options.label: No - cannot justify
options.reason: Insufficient employment history without acceptable justification

EMPLOYED_SECONDARY_HISTORY.question: How long has the secondary employment existed?

options.label: Less than 12 months
options.reason: Secondary employment requires minimum 12 months history

SECONDARY_SHORT_HISTORY_CHECK.question: Can 12-24 month history be justified?
SECONDARY_SHORT_HISTORY_CHECK.context: Examples: previous full-time job replaced by multiple part-time jobs, seasonal teaching positions

options.label: No - cannot justify
options.reason: Secondary employment requires 2 years or justified 12+ months

EARNINGS_TYPE.question: What type of earnings does the borrower receive?

options.label: Base Fluctuating Hourly (hours vary each pay period)
Weekly

calculation.formula: weekly_gross_pay × 52 ÷ 12
calculation.description: Multiply weekly pay by 52 weeks, divide by 12 months

documentation_required: W-2 for most recent year (primary) or 2 years (secondary)

options.label: Bi-Weekly (every 2 weeks)

calculation.formula: biweekly_gross_pay × 26 ÷ 12
calculation.description: Multiply bi-weekly pay by 26 periods, divide by 12 months

documentation_required: W-2 for most recent year (primary) or 2 years (secondary)

options.label: Semi-Monthly (twice per month)

calculation.formula: semimonthly_gross_pay × 24 ÷ 12
calculation.description: Multiply semi-monthly pay by 24 periods, divide by 12 months

documentation_required: W-2 for most recent year (primary) or 2 years (secondary)

options.label: Monthly

calculation.formula: monthly_gross_pay

documentation_required: W-2 for most recent year (primary) or 2 years (secondary)

options.label: Annual salary paid over less than 12 months (e.g., teachers)

calculation.formula: annual_gross_pay ÷ 12
calculation.description: Divide annual salary by 12 regardless of payment schedule

documentation_required: W-2 for most recent year (primary) or 2 years (secondary)
Documentation of annual salary and payment schedule

BASE_FLUCTUATING_HISTORY.question: Does borrower have at least 12 months of fluctuating hourly history?
BASE_FLUCTUATING_HISTORY.context: Can be from current employment, prior fluctuating employment, or combination with prior salaried in similar industry

options.label: No - less than 12 months
options.reason: Base fluctuating hourly requires minimum 12 months history

BASE_FLUCTUATING_TREND.question: What is the income trend (YTD vs prior year)?

BASE_FLUCTUATING_DEGREE.question: What is the degree of fluctuation (increase)?
BASE_FLUCTUATING_DEGREE.context: Compare YTD to prior year(s) to determine percentage change

options.label: ≤10% fluctuation (consistent)

calculation.formula: Average most recent year(s) and YTD income over applicable months
calculation.documentation: Standard documentation - no additional analysis required

documentation_required: W-2 for most recent year (primary) or 2 years (secondary)

options.label: >30% fluctuation

calculation.formula: Average most recent year(s) and YTD income

documentation_required: W-2 for most recent year (primary) or 2 years (secondary)

FLUCTUATION_10_TO_30_CHECK.question: Is increase supported by verified pay raise or documented income breakdown?

options.label: Yes - pay raise verified or income breakdown documented

calculation.option_1: Average most recent year(s) and YTD income
calculation.option_2: Apply current pay rate to average hours (if pay raise)
calculation.documentation: VOE or paystubs showing pay raise, or income breakdown

documentation_required: W-2 for most recent year (primary) or 2 years (secondary)
Pay raise verification or income breakdown

options.label: No - not supported

calculation.formula: Average most recent year(s) and YTD income

documentation_required: W-2 for most recent year (primary) or 2 years (secondary)

BASE_FLUCTUATING_DECLINING.question: What is the degree of decline?

options.label: ≤10% decline

calculation.formula: Use YTD income only (do not include prior higher level)
requirements: Support that current income has stabilized

documentation_required: W-2 for most recent year (primary) or 2 years (secondary)

options.label: >10% decline

calculation.formula: Use YTD income only (do not include prior higher level)
requirements: Support that current income has stabilized

documentation_required: W-2 for most recent year (primary) or 2 years (secondary)
Detailed documentation explaining decline and supporting stability

VARIABLE_INCOME_HISTORY.question: How long has borrower received this variable income?

options.label: Less than 12 months
options.reason: Variable income requires minimum 12 months history (exception may apply)

VARIABLE_SHORT_HISTORY_CHECK.question: Can less than 2-year history be justified?
VARIABLE_SHORT_HISTORY_CHECK.context: Consider income/employment characteristics, risk layering, demonstrated repayment ability

options.label: No - cannot justify
options.reason: Variable income requires 2 years or justified 12+ months history

options.label: Consistent or Increasing

calculation.formula: Average most recent years and YTD income over applicable months
calculation.note: If annual bonus: average over full years, not number of months on documentation

options.apply_trend_analysis: Same degree of fluctuation rules as base fluctuating hourly
documentation_required: W-2 forms for most recent 2 years

options.label: Declining

calculation.formula: Use YTD income (do not include prior higher level)
calculation.exception: May use prior level if documented one-time occurrence with return to prior level

documentation_required: W-2 forms for most recent 2 years

options.label: Military Base Pay (active duty)

calculation.formula: Based on pay frequency

documentation_required: YTD Military Leave and Earnings Statement

options.label: Military Entitlements (flight, hazard, quarters, rations, clothing)

calculation.formula: Current fixed monthly amount

documentation_required: YTD Military Leave and Earnings Statement
Or: Written VOE documenting current monthly fixed amount(s) + 10-day PCV

options.label: Reserve or National Guard

calculation.formula: Average earnings over 12 months

documentation_required: YTD Military Leave and Earnings Statement

RS_PERFORMANCE_HISTORY.question: How long has borrower received RS/RSU payouts from current employer?

calculation.shares: (200-day moving average price × vested shares in past 2 years) ÷ 24
calculation.cash: Total pre-tax cash equivalent in past 2 years ÷ 24

options.label: 12-24 months with current employer

requirements: Documented compensating factors (e.g., 5-year history with prior employer)
Cannot calculate on less than 12 months

documentation_required: Plus: Written analysis and compensating factors documentation

options.label: Less than 12 months
options.reason: Performance-based RS/RSU requires minimum 12 months vested distribution history

SELF_EMPLOYED_ROOT.question: What is the borrower's ownership percentage?
SELF_EMPLOYED_ROOT.context: Self-employed = 25%+ ownership in Partnership/S-corp/Corp, or 100% for sole proprietorship

options.label: Less than 25% ownership
options.note: Treat as employed income per Section 5303.1(e) or use self-employment rules

SELF_EMPLOYED_HISTORY.question: How long has borrower been self-employed in current business?

options.label: Less than 1 year
options.reason: Tax returns must reflect at least 1 year of self-employment income

SELF_EMPLOYED_SHORT_HISTORY.question: Does borrower have combined 2-year history in same/similar occupation?
SELF_EMPLOYED_SHORT_HISTORY.context: Current self-employment + prior job in same/similar occupation/industry

calculation.formula: Use LESSER of: stable monthly income from new business OR stable monthly income from previous occupation
requirements: May review YTD financial statement or 3 months business bank statements

options.label: No - cannot establish combined 2-year history
options.reason: Self-employment requires 2 years or combined history in same/similar occupation

options.label: Sole Proprietorship
documentation_required: Complete Form 1040 for most recent 2 years
Schedule C for most recent 2 years

options.label: Partnership or S-Corporation

calculation.cash_distributions: May establish liquidity but NOT qualifying income

documentation_required: Complete Form 1040 for most recent 2 years
Schedule K-1 for most recent 2 years
Business tax returns (Form 1065 or 1120-S) for most recent 2 years

options.label: Corporation
documentation_required: Complete Form 1040 for most recent 2 years
W-2 from business for most recent 2 years
Corporate tax returns (Form 1120) for most recent 2 years

RENTAL_SUBJECT_TRANSACTION.question: Is this a purchase or refinance?

options.label: Purchase Transaction

calculation.formula: 75% of (gross monthly rent from lease OR gross market rent from appraisal)
calculation.note: 25% adjustment for vacancies, operating costs, unexpected expenses

documentation_required: Existing lease (when available, current, fully executed in seller's name)
limitations: Each borrower must own Primary Residence or have rental payment
With 1+ year management experience: use full net rental income
Without management experience: limited to offsetting PITI, MI, HOA, secondary financing

RENTAL_SUBJECT_REFI_TIMING.question: When was property purchased or placed in service as rental?

options.label: Current Calendar Year

calculation.formula: 75% of gross monthly rent from lease

documentation_required: First rent payment due ≤ first mortgage payment due
Proof of income: Form 72/1000 OR 2 months rent received OR security deposit + first month

RENTAL_SUBJECT_REFI_PRIOR_CALC.question: Which calculation method will be used?

options.label: Schedule E from Tax Returns

step_2.exception: May use days in service if out of service for documented repairs/renovation

step_3.formula: Total net rental income (Step 1) ÷ Applicable months (Step 2)

documentation_required: Complete Form 1040 including Schedule E for most recent year

options.label: Lease (in lieu of Schedule E)

allowed_when: Most recent tax return doesn't include property on Schedule E (e.g., on extension)
Property out of service during prior year with documented repairs/renovation

calculation.formula: 75% of gross monthly rent from lease

documentation_required: Complete Form 1040 (even if property not on Schedule E)
First rent payment due ≤ first mortgage payment due
Proof of income: Form 72/1000 OR 2 months rent OR security deposit + first month

RENTAL_NON_SUBJECT_TIMING.question: When was property purchased or placed in service as rental?

options.label: Current Calendar Year

calculation.formula: 75% of gross monthly rent from lease

documentation_required: First rent payment due ≤ first mortgage payment due
Proof of income: Form 72/1000 OR 2 months rent OR security deposit + first month

options.label: Prior Calendar Year

calculation.note: Similar to subject property - use Schedule E or lease with same rules

documentation_required: Or: Lease with conditions allowing use in lieu of Schedule E

CALCULATE.action: Calculate income using the specified formula and documentation

CALCULATE_WITH_ANALYSIS.action: Calculate income with additional analysis and documentation
requirements: Document reason for condition (fluctuation, decline, short history)

REJECT.action: Income does not meet requirements - cannot be used for qualification
next_steps: Consider if borrower can wait to meet requirements

SEE_GUIDE.action: Refer to specific guide section for detailed requirements

USE_EMPLOYED_RULES.action: Use employed income rules instead of self-employment

usage_instructions.how_to_use: Start at the ROOT node and answer each question to traverse the tree
for_llm_agents: Present the question to determine classification
Follow the 'next_node' based on the answer
Continue until reaching an outcome (CALCULATE, REJECT, etc.)
Apply the specified calculation method and documentation requirements

log_format.example: Node: EMPLOYED_ROOT -> Choice: primary -> Node: EMPLOYED_HISTORY -> Choice: 2_years_plus -> Node: EARNINGS_TYPE -> Choice: base_non_fluctuating -> Outcome: CALCULATE with weekly pay frequency
